org.apache.flink.api.common.operators

Class SingleInputOperator<IN,OUT,FT extends Function>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.api.common.operators.Operator<OUT>
      • org.apache.flink.api.common.operators.AbstractUdfOperator<OUT,FT>
        • org.apache.flink.api.common.operators.SingleInputOperator<IN,OUT,FT>
  • Type Parameters:
    IN - Input type of the user function
    OUT - Output type of the user function
    FT - Type of the user function
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Visitable<Operator<?>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BulkIterationBase, CollectorMapOperatorBase, FilterOperatorBase, FlatMapOperatorBase, GroupReduceOperatorBase, MapOperatorBase, MapPartitionOperatorBase, NoOpUnaryUdfOp, PartitionOperatorBase, ReduceOperatorBase

    public abstract class SingleInputOperator<IN,OUT,FT extends Function>
extends AbstractUdfOperator<OUT,FT>
    Abstract superclass for for all operators that have one input like "map" or "reduce".

    • Constructor Detail

      • SingleInputOperator

        protected SingleInputOperator(UserCodeWrapper<FT> stub,
                              UnaryOperatorInformation<IN,OUT> operatorInfo,
                              int[] keyPositions,
                              String name)
        Creates a new abstract single-input operator with the given name wrapping the given user function.
        Parameters:
        stub - The object containing the user function.
        keyPositions - The field positions of the input records that act as keys.
        name - The given name for the operator, used in plans, logs and progress messages.

      • SingleInputOperator

        protected SingleInputOperator(UserCodeWrapper<FT> stub,
                              UnaryOperatorInformation<IN,OUT> operatorInfo,
                              String name)
        Creates a new abstract single-input operator with the given name wrapping the given user function. This constructor is specialized only for operators that require no keys for their processing.
        Parameters:
        stub - The object containing the user function.
        name - The given name for the operator, used in plans, logs and progress messages.

      • accept

        public void accept(Visitor<Operator<?>> visitor)
        Accepts the visitor and applies it this instance. The visitors pre-visit method is called and, if returning true, the visitor is recursively applied on the single input. After the recursion returned, the post-visit method is called.
        Parameters:
        visitor - The visitor.
        See Also:
        Visitable.accept(org.apache.flink.util.Visitor)
